opendial.modules

Interface Module

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ATTSpeech, DialogueRecorder, ForwardPlanner, GUIFrame, MaryTTS, ModuleExample1, ModuleExample2, NaoASR, NaoBehaviour, NaoButton, NaoPerception, NaoTTS, RewardLearner, Simulator, SphinxASR, WizardControl, WizardLearner

    public interface Module
    Representation of a system module. A module is connected to the dialogue system and can read and write to its dialogue state. It can also be paused/resumed.

    Two distinct families of modules can be distinguished:

    1. Asynchronous modules run independently of the dialogue system (once initiated by the method start().
    2. Synchronous modules are triggered upon an update of the dialogue state via the method trigger(state, updatedVars).

    Of course, nothing prevents in practice a module to operate both in synchronous and asynchronous mode.

    In order to make the module easy to load into the system (via e.g. the button "Load Modules" in the GUI toolbar or via the "<modules>" parameters in system settings), it is a good idea to ensure that implement each module with a constructor with a single argument: the DialogueSystem object to which it should be connected. Additional arguments can in this case be specified through parameters in the system settings. When necessary parameters are missing, a MissingParameterException should be thrown.

    Version:
    $Date:: 2014-10-16 00:07:06 #$
    Author:
    Pierre Lison (plison@ifi.uio.no)
